text: Olympic ice princess Nancy Kerrigan ’ s father died yesterday after a bizarre scuffle with his hotheaded jailbird son, who thought his dad was faking it when he collapsed in their Massachusetts home, officials said. Daniel Kerrigan, 70, became known to the world when he carried his injured, sobbing daughter after a vicious attack at a skating competition nearly derailed her Olympic dreams in 1994. Nancy ’ s brother Mark, 45, was charged with assault after he admitted locking his hands around his father ’ s throat in an early - morning melee over use of the telephone in the house they share in Stoneham, Mass., authorities said. Cops said he thought his dad was only pretending to be hurt when he fell to the floor. Charges against the son could be upgraded after the release of autopsy results that will
